organizations: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee

thread.title: Scott Walker: I would sign 20-week abortion ban
thread.title_full: Scott Walker: I would sign 20-week abortion ban

title: Scott Walker: I would sign 20-week abortion ban
text:
CNN.com
Scott Walker: I would sign 20-week abortion ban Updated 0050 GMT (0750 HKT) June 2, 2015 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker fields questions from Bruce Rastetter at the Iowa Agriculture Summit on March 7, 2015 in Des Moines, Iowa. Hide Caption 1 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker speaks at the annual Conservative Political Action Conference at National Harbor, Maryland, outside Washington, D.C. on February 26, 2015. Hide Caption 2 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker speaks to guests at the Iowa Freedom Summit on January 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. Hide Caption 3 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker speaks at his election night party November 4, 2014, in West Allis, Wisconsin. Walker defeated the Democratic challenger Mary Burke. Hide Caption 4 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker shakes hands with Democrat challenger Mary Burke before facing off in a debate at the WMVS-TV studios October, 17, 2014, in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 5 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker has a scarf put on his head during a special service at the Sikh Religious Society of Wisconsin for the victims of the shooting at the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin the previous day, on August 6, 2012, in Brookfield, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 6 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker speaks during the Republican Jewish Coalition spring leadership meeting at The Venetian Las Vegas on March 29, 2014. Hide Caption 7 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Scott Walker (left) shakes hands with Chinese President Xi Jinping (center) before a meeting as Iowa Governor Terry Branstad (right) looks on at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on April 15, 2013. Hide Caption 8 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker poses with a woman during the Republican National Convention at the Tampa Bay Times Forum on August 28, 2012, in Tampa, Florida. Hide Caption 9 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker prepares to cast his ballot at Jefferson School to vote in the gubernatorial recall election June 5, 2012, in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 10 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker (right) listens to Louisiana Gov. Bobby Jindal speak as they campaign at the Waukesha Victory Center on May 24, 2012, in Waukesha, Wisconsin. Hide Caption Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker addresses the National Rifle Association Leadership Forum April 13, 2012, in St. Louis, Missouri. Hide Caption 12 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker stands on the North Lawn of the White House before making remarks to the news media after a meeting of the National Governors Association with President Barack Obama on February 27, 2012. Hide Caption 13 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos President Barack Obama receives a Milwaukee Brewers baseball jersey from Walker (left) as he disembarks from Air Force One upon arrival at General Mitchell International Airport in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, February 15, 2012. Hide Caption 14 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker listens during the 2011 Governors Summit of U.S. Chamber of Commerce June 20, 2011, in Washington, D.C. Hide Caption 15 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Members of Code Pink (left to right) Medea Benjamin, Liz Hourican and Tighe Barry, hold signs to protest as Walker (center) takes his seat during a hearing before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee April 14, 2011, on Capitol Hill in Washington, D.C. Hide Caption 16 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker holds a letter from democratic State Sen. Mark Miller, one of the fourteen Wisconsin state senators who fled the state over two weeks ago, during a press conference on March 7, 2011, in Madison, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 17 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker holds up a 'Wisconsin is open for business' bumper sticker as he speaks during a ceremonial bill signing outside his office at the Wisconsin State Capitol on March 11, 2011, in Madison, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 18 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker delivers his budget address to a joint session of the legislature at the capitol March 1, 2011 in Madison, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 19 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos Walker speaks at a news conference inside the Wisconsin State Capitol February 21, 2011, in Madison, Wisconsin. Hide Caption 20 of 21 Scott Walker's career 21 photos President Obama receives a Green Bay Packers NFL football team jersey with 'Obama #1' written on it from Walker (left) at Austin Straubel International Airport in Green Bay, Wisconsin, on January 26, 2011. Hide Caption 21 of 21 Washington (CNN) Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker reiterated on Monday he would sign a state law that would outlaw abortions after 20 weeks, including pregnancies that result from rape or incest. The all-but-certain presidential candidate told reporters in his home state he would sign the bill currently working its way through Wisconsin's Republican-controlled legislature. In March, in an open letter to the women's group Susan B. Anthony List, Walker had said he would approve the legislation if it reached his desk. JUST WATCHED
